title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-9.32 - Boiler bushing, flange, for feed pipe connections
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 14-9.32 - Boiler bushing, flange, for feed pipe connections

State Regulations
(a) Figure P-42 illustrates a typical form of
flange for use on boiler shells for passing through piping such as feed, surface blowoff connections, etc., and which permits of the pipes being screwed
in solid from both sides in addition to the reinforcing of the opening in the
shell. The pipes shall be attached as provided in section
14-9.23
of this Subpart. (b) In these and other types of boilers where
both internal and external pipes making a continuous passage are employed, the
boiler bushing or its equivalent shall be used. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
14-9.32

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
